\r

variant.question: You receive a TCAS RA and execute the manoeuvre, but before you can transmit to ATC, another traffic reports an urgency. What should you do?

Return to the previous flight level and interrupt the urgency transmission to report the TCAS advisory.
Remain at the new altitude and fly a holding pattern until the urgent transmission has ended, then advise ATC and request a new FL.
Remain at the new altitude until the urgent transmission has ended, then advise ATC and request a new FL.

variant.question: On a pilot’s active VHF frequency, another traffic has declared a state of urgency. Urgency is defined as a condition...

options.text: concerning the safety of an aircraft or other vehicle, or of some person on board or within sight, but which does not require immediate assistance.
concerning the immediate safety of an aircraft or other vehicle, or of some person on board or within sight, which requires immediate assistance.
concerning the illegal seizure of an aircraft in transit and forcing it to go to a different destination, which requires immediate assistance.
of being in serious and/or imminent danger and of requiring immediate assistance.

variant.question: You receive an urgency message on the international distress frequency, but no other station answers. You are required, amongst other actions, to..

options.text: acknowledge the message to the aircraft in the state of urgency, then take immediate action to make all necessary information available to the appropriate Air Traffic Service unit.

retransmit the urgency message as it was originally transmitted on the international distress frequency using your own call sign, but do not communicate directly with the aircraft that made the original transmission.
acknowledge the message to the aircraft in the state of urgency, and await for instructions from the pilot of the calling aircraft.

retransmit the urgency message as it was originally transmitted on the frequency with which you are in communication with ATC, but do not communicate directly with the aircraft that made the original transmission.

variant.question: You receive an urgency message on the international distress frequency, but no other station answers. You are required, amongst other actions, to...

options.text: acknowledge the message to the aircraft in the state of urgency, then take immediate action to make all necessary information available to the appropriate Air Traffic Service unit.

retransmit the urgency message as it was originally transmitted on the frequency with which you are in communication with ATC, but do not communicate directly with the aircraft that made the original transmission.

retransmit the urgency message as it was originally transmitted on the international distress frequency using your own call sign, but do not communicate directly with the aircraft that made the original transmission.
acknowledge the message to the aircraft in the state of urgency, and await any instructions the pilot might give you.

To allow for direct contact between the emergency aircraft and rescue and firefighting services on a discrete frequency.
